review: I got in on the Apple TV with the 2nd generation TV.  The current generation, the third one, is the best. 1080p content streamed to your television from your Apple cloud (any music, music video, tv show, movie, etc) or from your iTunes on your computer. You can also watch live and on zed,and content from many of the major network players like HBO, Disney etc. there's also sports fare like MLB, NHL etc for the sports fanatic. In addition, you have Netflix, YouTube and more.These days, I'm watching more content on my Apple TV from my BluRay digital copies, things I've rented or purchased from iTunes and Netflix content then watching regular TV. It's literally amazing.As always, the interface is easy and intuitive like any Apple product.It's extremely small, about the size of a hockey puck and unobtrusive. There's nothing dangling from the side of your tv like with Chromecast.If you're in the iTunes ecosystem it's an absolute no brainer. If you're on the fence, take the plunge. You won't know how you went without it before.

review: I am not one for lengthy reviews so I will keep it short and to the point. The Apple TV works very easy right out of the box and looks great. The controller is very user friendly even for children. We use this almost every day to stream Netflix and Hulu. It also does a great job at mirroring your computer and playing youtube videos and songs from any apple wifi device.Overall a great product and beats out roku any day of the week for me. I would recommend this over any like device.
author: Hambone

review: I have purchased 3 of these to have one on each TV.  I really like the way it interacts with all of my devices and provides both air play and access to my iTunes library for music, photos and movies.  I really haven't found anything to complain about other than you do have to check for software & firmware updates, there is no notification.
